1.text: And Jehovah answereth Job out of the whirlwind, and saith:—

2.text: Who is this—darkening counsel, By words without knowledge?

3.text: Gird, I pray thee, as a man, thy loins, And I ask thee, and cause thou Me to know.

4.text: Where wast thou when I founded earth? Declare, if thou hast known understanding.

5.text: Who placed its measures—if thou knowest? Or who hath stretched out upon it a line?

6.text: On what have its sockets been sunk? Or who hath cast its corner-stone?

7.text: In the singing together of stars of morning, And all sons of God shout for joy,

8.text: And He shutteth up with doors the sea, In its coming forth, from the womb it goeth out.

9.text: In My making a cloud its clothing, And thick darkness its swaddling band,

10.text: And I measure over it My statute, And place bar and doors,

11.text: And say, ‘Hitherto come thou, and add not, And a command is placed On the pride of thy billows.’

12.text: Hast thou commanded morning since thy days? Causest thou the dawn to know its place?

13.text: To take hold on the skirts of the earth, And the wicked are shaken out of it,

14.text: It turneth itself as clay of a seal And they station themselves as clothed.

15.text: And withheld from the wicked is their light, And the arm lifted up is broken.

16.text: Hast thou come in to springs of the sea? And in searching the deep Hast thou walked up and down?

17.text: Revealed to thee were the gates of death? And the gates of death-shade dost thou see?

18.text: Thou hast understanding, Even unto the broad places of earth! Declare—if thou hast known it all.

19.text: Where is this—the way light dwelleth? And darkness, where is this—its place?

20.text: That thou dost take it unto its boundary, And that thou dost understand The paths of its house.

21.text: Thou hast known—for then thou art born And the number of thy days are many!

22.text: Hast thou come in unto the treasure of snow? Yea, the treasures of hail dost thou see?

23.text: That I have kept back for a time of distress, For a day of conflict and battle.

24.text: Where is this, the way light is apportioned? It scattereth an east wind over the earth.

25.text: Who hath divided for the flood a conduit? And a way for the lightning of the voices?

26.text: To cause it to rain on a land—no man, A wilderness—no man in it.

27.text: To satisfy a desolate and waste place, And to cause to shoot up The produce of the tender grass?

28.text: Hath the rain a father? Or who hath begotten the drops of dew?

29.text: From whose belly came forth the ice? And the hoar-frost of the heavens, Who hath begotten it?

30.text: As a stone waters are hidden, And the face of the deep is captured.

31.text: Dost thou bind sweet influences of Kimah? Or the attractions of Kesil dost thou open?

32.text: Dost thou bring out Mazzaroth in its season? And Aysh for her sons dost thou comfort?

33.text: Hast thou known the statutes of heaven? Or dost thou appoint Its dominion in the earth?

34.text: Dost thou lift up to the cloud thy voice, And abundance of water doth cover thee?

35.text: Dost thou send out lightnings, and they go And say unto thee, ‘Behold us?’

36.text: Who hath put in the inward parts wisdom? Or who hath given To the covered part understanding?

37.text: Who doth number the clouds by wisdom? And the bottles of the heavens, Who doth cause to lie down,

38.text: In the hardening of dust into hardness, And clods cleave together?

39.text: Dost thou hunt for a lion prey? And the desire of young lions fulfil?

40.text: When they bow down in dens—Abide in a thicket for a covert?

41.text: Who doth prepare for a raven his provision, When his young ones cry unto God? They wander without food.
